```{r,message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(ggridges)
library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)
```

```{r}
library(p8105.datasets)
data("instacart") 
df_insta=data.frame(instacart)|>
  group_by(aisle_id)|>
  summarize(n_obs=n())|>
  arrange(desc(n_obs))

plot=df_insta|>
  filter(n_obs>10000)|>
  ggplot(aes(x=aisle_id,y=n_obs))+geom_point()+
  xlab("Aisle Id") +
  ylab("Number of items") +
  theme_bw()
print(plot)

table=data.frame(instacart)|>
  filter(aisle %in% c("dog food care","packaged vegetables fruits","baking ingredients"))|>
  group_by(aisle)|>
  count(product_id,name="n_item")|>
  arrange(aisle,desc(n_item))|>
  slice_head(n=3)|>
  rename("Aisle"="aisle",
         "Product ID"="product_id",
         "Number of Items"="n_item")
knitr::kable(table,digits=0)
```

1. There are `r nrow(df_insta)` aisles and most items are ordered from aisle number `r df_insta[1,1]`
